_comment: Pelican Panel Egg for Hybrowse Hytale Server - v2.0
name: Hytale Server (Hybrowse)
author: scotthowson@hybrowse.gg
description:
Production-ready Hytale dedicated server powered by Hybrowse.

Features:
• Automatic server file downloads & updates
• AOT compilation for fast startup (auto-generated)
• Built-in CurseForge mod management
• Automatic backups with retention
• Persistent authentication
• Security-first design

QUICK START:
1. Start the server - watch console for device code URL
2. Visit URL and enter code to authenticate downloader
3. Once booted, run: /auth login device
4. Follow the URL + code shown
5. Players can now connect!

Docs: https://github.com/scotthowson/hytale-server-pelican

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

cd /mnt/server

echo ""
echo "========================================"
echo "  Hybrowse Hytale Server Installation"
echo "========================================"
echo ""

# Set permissions for container user (UID 1000)
chown -R 1000:1000 /mnt/server 2>/dev/null || true
chmod -R 755 /mnt/server

echo "Directory prepared for Hytale server."
echo ""
echo "The Docker image handles:"
echo "  ✓ Automatic server downloads"
echo "  ✓ AOT cache generation"
echo "  ✓ CurseForge mods (optional)"
echo "  ✓ Automatic backups (optional)"
echo ""
echo "========================================"
echo "  AUTHENTICATION (First Start)"
echo "========================================"
echo ""
echo "1. Start server - watch for device code URL"
echo "2. Visit URL, enter code to download files"
echo "3. After boot, run: /auth login device"
echo "4. Follow URL + code to authenticate"
echo "5. Done! Players can connect."
echo ""
echo "========================================"
echo ""

variables.name: Auto Download
variables.description: Automatically download Hytale server files using the official downloader. First run requires device code authentication.

variables.name: Auto Update
variables.description: Check for and download server updates on startup.

variables.name: Server Port
variables.description: UDP port for Hytale (QUIC protocol). Must match allocation.

variables.name: JVM Memory (MB)
variables.description: Maximum JVM heap size in megabytes. Examples: 4096 (4GB), 8192 (8GB), 16384 (16GB). Should not exceed server allocation.

variables.name: JVM Min Memory (MB)
variables.description: Minimum JVM heap size in megabytes. Leave as 0 to not set. Recommended: same as max for dedicated servers.

variables.name: AOT Cache
variables.description: Ahead-Of-Time compilation for faster startup. Auto = generate if missing, true = require, false = disable.

variables.name: Authentication Mode
variables.description: authenticated = requires login, offline = no auth required, insecure = testing only

variables.name: Machine ID
variables.description: 32-char hex string for auth persistence. Auto-generated if empty. Only set when migrating servers.

variables.name: Backup Frequency (min)
variables.description: Minutes between backups. Only applies if backups enabled.

variables.name: Backup Retention
variables.description: Number of backups to keep. Oldest deleted automatically.

variables.name: CurseForge API Key
variables.description: API key from console.curseforge.com (required for mod downloads)

variables.name: Allow Self-Op
variables.description: Allow /op command for self-promotion. WARNING: Grants admin access!

variables.name: JVM Extra Args
variables.description: Additional JVM arguments for advanced tuning.
